title: summary element
description: The details element represents a disclosure widget from which the user can obtain additional information or controls. Note that per the HTML5 spec, headings are allowed in the summary element.

references.title: WHATWG HTML5 spec for the summary element

related_issues.title: NVDA issue for change of state
NVDA issue for change of state (when a heading is used)
JAWS issue for missing heading semantics

assertions.title: convey the name of the summary button
assertions.rationale: A user needs to know the name of the content that can be expanded or collapsed.
examples: A screen reader might announce something like "<role>, <name>"
Voice control software might allow the user to say something like "click <name>"

assertions.title: convey the button role
assertions.rationale: A user needs to be aware that they are entering grouped content.
examples: A screen reader might announce something like "button", "details", or "summary"
Voice control software might allow the user to say something like "click button"

assertions.title: convey the expanded state
assertions.rationale: A user needs to know when they enter and exist the details.
examples: A screen reader might announce either "expanded" or "collapsed"

assertions.title: convey when the expanded state is changed
assertions.rationale: A user needs to know when the state changes and that their action was successful.
examples: A screen reader might announce the new new state value, either "expanded" or "collapsed"

assertions.title: provide shortcuts to jump to the summary button
assertions.rationale: A user might want to jump to the button.
